      • CourtHive/Live

    Scoring Matches

    Once draws have been completed they become available for scoring.

    Scores can be entered directly into Draws and Brackets, on the Matches Tab, or in the Schedule.

    Elimination Draws

    When Elimination Draws are complete, the matches which may be scored are highlighed.

    Round Robin Brackets

    Positions which may be scored are highlighed in blue when the mouse hovers over them.

    Positions which are invalid for scoring because of Byes are colored light yellow.

    Score Entry

    The method of score entry is the same for all events.

    Active selectors are white and are used to enter the number of games won by each player.

    Scoring Format

    To change scoring for an single match, click the icon in the upper right hand corner to toggle Scoring Configuration.

    Auto Completion

    Only a single value needs to be provided for each set, the lower number of Games Won.

    The complementary value is calculated automatically and scoring advances to the next set, if the match is incomplete.

    Modifying Set Scores

    If the score for a set needs to be modified, clicking on either of the players’ scores takes the focus back to that set.

    Incomplete Matches, Retirements, Walkovers and Defaults

    Clicking on the green dash “-“ to the right of the set scores presents options for completing the match scoring by Retirement, Walkover, or Default, as well as the option to mark a match as Interrupted or “Live”.

    Accepting Match Scores

    When scoring is complete the “Accept” button sumbmits the score.

    Editing Match Scores

    Match scores may be edited by clicking on existing scores.

    When a match has been completed, scoring for subsequent matches is enabled.

    Removing Matches

    Match results can be removed from a Draw or Bracket by Context Clicking.

    Match results are also removed when scoring is cleared in the scoring dialogue.

    Tiebreak Scores

    Entry of tiebreak scores is similar to entering set scores except that an entry field is used instead of a selector.

    Important: Since entry fields are used for tiebreak scores the Enter/Return key must be pressed to complete scoring.
